lead_paragraph: KRAVET--Stanley, 81, passed peacefully at home in Manhasset, NY, with his family and devoted wife Rhoda Kravet by his side. Born in 1934 in Brooklyn, NY to Rose and Morris Kravet, he graduated from Boys High and NYU School of Business, where he met his wife. He attended Brooklyn Law School on a full scholarship and after graduating he began working at Royal Abstract, a New York City title insurance agency. He spent over 45 years building Royal Abstract into a well known and successful company and welcomed his son Martin into the business in 1985. He was very well respected by all who knew him. Outside of his work he was involved in the rebuilding of the Jewish Center of Bayside Oaks, in Queens. He enjoyed golf and was an esteemed member of Engineers Country Club and Cold Spring Country Club. He and his wife spent winters at Boca West in Boca Raton, Florida where they were members of Boca West Country Club. He was a kind and proud man who was devoted to his family. He is survived by his wife of 59 years, Rhoda, loving father to son Martin (wife Susan) and daughter Susan Pecker (husband Elliot) and his adored grandchildren, Justin, Rachel, Dylan and Caroline. He was a loving husband, father, grandfather and brother and he will be greatly missed. Funeral service will be held at Riverside Chapel, 180 West 76th Street, in New York City on Friday, January 8 at 12pm. 1/3
